result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bianca Nicole McLin

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Filed by Atty. McMahon asking the have the 10/6/2022 Plea/sentencing hearing rescheduled.  **Reviewed by Judge Reilly, for Branch 7, 10/6/55 - Approved.**
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

11:10 AM; Case called for Hearing. Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Bianca Nicole McLin appeared by Zoom video.  Attorney Maura Ann Mcmahon appeared by Zoom video for Bianca Nicole McLin. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. Atty. McMahon notes her and her client are by Zoom video today as her client had transportation issues.  Atty. McMahon provides an update, she is trying to negotiate the matter with the State.  Atty. McMahon is hoping to resolve this matter short of trial and is requesting a projected plea and sentencing date in about 6 weeks.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on August 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:49 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Bianca Nicole McLin in court with attorney Maura Ann Mcmahon.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. McMahon provides an update, she is working on reviewing discovery and has sent a counter-offer to the State.  Atty. McMahon requests another further proceedings date.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.  Hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Hearing on July 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.

11:20 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Bianca Nicole McLin in court with attorney Steven Hughes, for attorney Maura Ann Mcmahon.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Hughes provides an update, he advises Atty. McMahon has discovery but needs additional time to review it with her client.  Atty. Hughes requests a further proceedings date in about 45 days.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.  Hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on May 26, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Letter requesting to withdraw motion for bail hearing
**Clerk notes matter will be removed as defendant has posted and been released- MAM**
Bail/bond hearing on April 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

09:38 AM Defendant Bianca Nicole McLin in court, in custody, with attorney Maura Ann Mcmahon.   Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Date remains as previously set.
Bail/bond hearing on April 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
